exclamation.description: A word said to frighten or drive away a person or animal.

verb.description: Make (a person or animal) go away by waving one's arms at them, saying “shoo,” or otherwise acting in a discouraging manner.
examples: I went to comfort her but she shooed me away

origin: A natural exclamation: first recorded in late Middle English. The verb use dates from the early 17th century.
